title: Citadel NIL Clubs

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records for all Name Image and Likeness (NIL) Clubs for NCAA teams and/or athletes at The Citadel to include, without limitation, Club Charters, operating proceedures, members, faculty or other advisors, financial records and all regulations, policies, Memorandums and proceedures that govern their creation, operation, membership, disbursement of funds, and other matters for the period August 1, 2022 - the date of this request. Records should also include any and all exemptions from Citadel policies, regulations, memorandums or other governance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Citadel Cadet Activity Fees

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing what specifically is included in the “Cadet Activity Fee” cadets are chared as part of their tuition under other fees as well as the financial records showing ledger itemized income and expenditures for Cadet Activity fees for the 2008 – 2009, 2009 – 2010, 2020 – 2021, 2021 – 2022, 2022 – 2023, 2023 – 2024 and 2024 – 2025 academic years including how this fee per cadet was determine, who approved the fee, all income to this fund by source, and all expenditures for these funds to the line-item level by student or other activity. For 2024 – 2025 include what is programmed, allocated and committed to date. Itemized expenditures are requested for the amount allocated and line-item expenditures to each club and student organization and what was budgeted for each for the selected academic years what will enable analysis of allocated to expended and within expenditures identify what products or services were procured. These should include the portion of these fees allocated for cadet activities consisting of facilities maintenance, debt service, cadet counseling services, cadet organizations and any other expenditures from this fund by office or organization that expended the funds, by supply or service purchased. Itemized expenditures by category and organization should total the amount reported as collected from Cadets and other identified sources. This information should be readily available in any reasonable standard accounting system using acceptable accounting practices and so should not require a significant level of efforts to identify and provide those records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Citadel Cadet Uniform Fees

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing what specifically is included in the “Uniform fees” that are part of the Sudent activities fees charged cadets at The Citadel as well as the financial records showing ledger level itemized income and expenditures for Uniforms fees for the 2020 – 2021, 2021 – 2022, 2022 – 2023, 2023 – 2024 and 2024 – 2025 academic years including how this fee per cadet was determine, who approved the fee, all income to this fund by source, and all expenditures for these funds to the line-item level. For 2024 – 2025 include what is programmed, allocated and committed to date. These should include the portion of these fees allocated for uniforms and related Activities to include, without limitation, a definition of each “ Activity”. Itemized expenditures for uniforms and related Activities should total the amount reported as collected from Cadets and other identified sources. Itemized expenditures are requested for the amount allocated and line-item expenditures to each areas and what was budgeted for each for the selected academic years what will enable analysis of allocated to expended and within expenditures identify what products or services were procured. This information should be readily available in any reasonable standard accounting system using acceptable accounting practices and so should not require a significant level of efforts to identify and provide those records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Voluntary Recognitions for Quarter 4, 2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Voluntary Recognitions for Quarter 4, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from October 1, 2024 through December 31, 2024. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Danziger Bridge shootings Investigation files

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Danziger Bridge shootings Investigation files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Text, Image, Audio, and or Video files from the investigation of the Danziger Bridge Shootings of September 4, 2005 in New Orleans.
Documents pertaining to Kenneth Bowen, Robert Faulcon Jr., Robert Gisevius Jr., Anthony Villavaso and Arthur Kaufman within the scope of the investigation as well as any documents related to them since their releases from prison.
Documents related to the attempted coverup within the department following the Danziger Bridge Shootings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Nordberg

title: Contract and Proposals for RFQ # 25ITS81MP01 For the Massachusetts EEC Family Portal and Case Management System (Commonweath Of Massachusetts Executive Office Of Education)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All proposals submitted for RFQ # 25ITS81MP01 For the Massachusetts EEC Family Portal and Case Management System. Also please find the scoring, and the resulting contract awarded to NAVA PBC. The RFP was issued in October of 2024, and awarded in December 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

title: Contract and Proposals for RFQ # 25ITS81MP01 For the Massachusetts EEC Family Portal and Case Management System (Everett)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All proposals submitted for RFQ # 25ITS81MP01 For the Massachusetts EEC Family Portal and Case Management System. Also please find the scoring, and the resulting contract awarded to NAVA PBC. The RFP was issued in October of 2024, and awarded in December 2024.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

title: Find the proposal by Childcare Education Institute submitted for RFP 30-23189-DCDEE for the North Carolina Workforce Registry

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Find the proposal by Childcare Education Institute submitted for RFP 30-23189-DCDEE for the North Carolina Workforce Registry
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Find the proposal by Childcare Education Institute submitted for RFP 30-23189-DCDEE for the North Carolina Workforce Registry and NC Pre-K and Regulatory System Replacement. Proposals were due on August 17, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

title: Deloitte contract for CCWIS System Integrator RFP B16539/B17047 with the Illinois Department of Early Childhood

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Find the request for proposal, statement of work, award notice, and all documents related to the contract award to Deloitte for Illinois Department of Early Childhood CCWIS System Integrator RFP B16539/B17047; Notice of Award made Dec 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

title: Contracts and vendor materials of artificial intelligence FOIA programs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Contracts and vendor materials of artificial intelligence FOIA programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All marketing material and contract documents related to the artificial intelligence programs described in the Department of Commerce's 2024 Chief FOIA Officer report (https://www.commerce.gov/sites/default/files/2024-03/DOC%202024%20Chief%20FOIA%20Officer%20Report.pdf).

The materials I request include:
- All marketing materials, brochures, sales pitches and/or other literature.
- Any lists of related contracts.
- Any contracts, including any pilot, proof-of-concept, and public-private partnership agreements.
- Any data purchase, licensing, or exchange agreements.
- Any privacy policies or terms of use/service.
- Any vendor distribution lists for related requests for proposals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Auditing and testing of artificial intelligence FOIA programs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Auditing and testing of artificial intelligence FOIA programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All trust or safety assessments and internal audits of the artificial intelligence programs described in the Department of Commerce's 2024 Chief FOIA Officer report (https://www.commerce.gov/sites/default/files/2024-03/DOC%202024%20Chief%20FOIA%20Officer%20Report.pdf).

Executive Order 13960 (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2020/12/08/2020-27065/promoting-the-use-of-trustworthy-artificial-intelligence-in-the-federal-government) maintained that agencies should  "monitor, audit, and document compliance" of their AI use cases.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

All marketing material and contract documents related to the artificial intelligence programs described as the "Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Discovery AI Pilot," "AI Pilot for National Declassification Center (NDC) at NARA", " Develop a Custom Large Language Model (LLM) to Power Generative AI- Capabilities", and "Develop a Natural Language Based Chat Interface (like ChatGPT) to Interact With the Archival Documents" in the Archives' inventory of AI use-cases (https://www.archives.gov/ai).

- All marketing materials, brochures, sales pitches and/or other literature.
- Any lists of related contracts.
- Any contracts, including any pilot, proof-of-concept, and public-private partnership agreements.

title: Contracts and vendor materials of artificial intelligence FOIA programs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Contracts and vendor materials of artificial intelligence FOIA programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All marketing material and contract documents related to the AI and FOIA pilot programs described in the State Department's 2024 Chief FOIA Officer report (https://foia.state.gov/Learn/Reports/Officer/2024.pdf), including the declassification pilot program and the efforts, as described by the Department, "to identify similar FOIA requests, conduct searches of the Department’s centralized databases for potentially responsive records, and improve the public website including customer experience for site visitors," which the Department states are "in pilot stages." 

The materials I request include:
- All marketing materials, brochures, sales pitches and/or other literature.
- Any lists of related contracts.
- Any contracts, including any pilot, proof-of-concept, and public-private partnership agreements.
- Any data purchase, licensing, or exchange agreements.
- Any privacy policies or terms of use/service.
- Any vendor distribution lists for related requests for proposals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All trust or safety assessments and internal audits of the artificial intelligence programs described in the State Department's 2024 Chief FOIA Officer report (https://foia.state.gov/Learn/Reports/Officer/2024.pdf), including the declassification pilot program and the efforts, as described by the Department, "to identify similar FOIA requests, conduct searches of the Department’s centralized databases for potentially responsive records, and improve the public website including customer experience for site visitors," which the Department states are "in pilot stages." 

A recent reported titled "Artificial Intelligence Strategy: Empowering Diplomacy through Responsible AI" (https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&opi=89978449&url=https://www.state.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Department-of-State-Enterprise-Artificial-Intelligence-Strategy.pdf&ved=2ahUKEwiH0IaRuuGKAxW6w_ACHQZNDCsQFnoECAcQAQ&usg=AOvVaw0asR7_b3bnWjpG_Ns3VAeE) states that "Regular safety and trustworthy assessments and internal audits will be required to manage risks" of the Department's AI strategy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Incident Request

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Incident Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives,  the CAD log detailing the sequence of events, including all times and actions taken by dispatch and responding units during this incident, any police radio dispatch communications concerning the incident, including initial dispatch and subsequent communications related to the incident, a copy of any 911 calls, calls for service,  and any communications with other agency regarding a social media video recorded at the John Carrol School Campus this month. Please see the attached document for further information regarding this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

title: Lab Fees and Tuition Dollars

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Lab Fees and Tuition Dollars
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Financial records maintained by the College delineating total fees collected from students classified as “Lab Fees” for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please include a breakdown of lab fees by academic department/unit of the College.

2) Financial records maintained by the College outlining expenses paid by lab fees monies for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please include a breakdown of the expenses funded by "Lab Fees" monies by academic department/unit of the College.

3) Financial records maintained by the College delineating tuition dollars collected for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please breakdown the tuition by student’s declared degree program for the following programs: 
-Associate of Applied Science in Maritime Technology and Operations 
-Bachelor of Engineering in Electrical Engineering, Facilities Engineering, Marine Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture 
-Bachelor of Science in International Transportation and Trade, Marine Environmental Science, Maritime Studies, Marine Operations, Marine Transportation, Data Science and Machine Learning
-Master of Science in Shipping and Logistics, Maritime and Naval Studies 

4) For each record identified in the requests above, please provide an explanation of all abbreviations or acronyms in the records.

To the extent that records are available in electronic format ideally in either an electronic spreadsheet or comma-separated format (Excel or CSV). 

If any records are unavailable within five business days of receipt of the request, and responsive records exist, I seek a description of such records and a timeline of when access to the records will be provided. If you determine that certain parts of this request may be more easily produced than others, please provide records on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

A. Eric Pasillas

title: David Lakeman letter to CCC

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: David Lakeman letter to CCC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the letter that CCC Executive Director candidate David Lakeman sent to the commission turning down the job offer for ED.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Faraone

title: Department of Justice OIG - Cyber Attack Logs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Justice OIG - Cyber Attack Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information Requested:

Please produce any and all records related to the DOJ OIG documenting 'attacks' on the DOJ OIG website assigning an 'Attack ID#'s and Message ID#' to each website attack. 

Include but do not limit this to any summaries, recommendations, findings,  provided to DOJ OIG management or referred to other DOJ entities for possible investigation or prosecution in relation to the tracking of threats related to these alleged 'attacks'.

The requester is completing an public investigation in corroborating to a statement provided by DOJ OIG Michael Horowitz in relation to issues attracting top cybertalent to the agency.  

Dates for search: 05/12/2023 - 10/12/2023

EFOIA Request

Fee waiver requested for broad public interest and newsmedia. 

Related:
https://potomacofficersclub.com/news/new-report-shows-doj-losing-cyber-talent-to-other-agencies/
https://oig.justice.gov/reports/department-justice-top-management-and-performance-challenges-2023/human-capital


William Fernandes

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

title: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Cecil Yahtin

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Cecil Yahtin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Cecil Yahtin
Description/Headline: Victim in Hazelwood Neighborhood Homicide Identified
Link of the Article: https: //www.portlandoregon.gov/police/news/read.cfm?id=533271
State: Portland OR
Law Enforcement: Portland Oregon Police (Det. Tony Harris)

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

david yupa

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and files, including letters, memos, emails, and all communications that mention Cheyenne River Sioux activist Lehman "Lee" Brightman (born 1930 - died June 8, 2017). 

An obituary can be found at Lakota Country Times: https://www.lakotatimes.com/articles/lehman-l-brightman/. A PDF copy is attached.

I would also like to request a search of all available cross-index files for mentions of Lehman "Lee" Brightman in other documents, to be included with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Agency Roster (East Lyme Police Department)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Agency Roster (East Lyme Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On December 18, 2024 Governor Abbott announced that the Public Safety Office will administer over $500 million in grant funding for a variety of public safety programs and services in Texas, including 98 awards, totaling $4.6 million, to equip peace officers with body-worn camera systems.  Please provide a list of those agencies receiving body-worn camera awards, showing the amounts awarded to each agency (if available).  If a list of the awardees does not exist, please provide any documents, reports, data files, or communications that identify the body-worn camera award recipients.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: NCAA Athlete LIL Policies and payments

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: NCAA Athlete LIL Policies and payments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The NCAA $2.7 billion settlement in October 2024, allows Division I schools to compensate athletes directly and provide new payments and benefits.  Virginia Code § 22.1-212.2:4. Interscholastic athletics; student-athletes; compensation and representation for name, image, or likeness allows student-athletes at public and private higher education institutions to receive compensation for the use of their NIL. 

This FOIA request records covering the development and approval of VMI policies governing such compensation that the institute is responsible for establishing policies to comply with state legislation and NCAA regulations, ensuring that athletes are informed and supported in regard to these opportunities as well as who approved these policies and proceedures and when if not shown on the records themselves. These shoudl include, without limitation, and communications, training or other information provided to eleigible NCAA athletes (former and current). Records requested also include those whowing the number of former athletes who graduated from VMI or departed VMI for any reason, including the Portal, that are eligible for compensation. 

If the required policies, processes, proceedures and other records are not yet developed by VMI place confirm that none exist and are in place now with records showing the proposed timeline for their development, approval, and implementation as well as the range of years the compensation will cover for NCAA athletes who are no longer cadets at VMI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: NIL Clubs at VMI

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: NIL Clubs at VMI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records for all Name Image and Likeness Clubs for NCAA teams and/or athletes at VMI to include, without limitation, Club Charters, operating proceedures, members, faculty or other advisors, financial records and all regulations, policies, Memorandums and proceedures that govern their creation, operation, membership, disbursement of funds, and other matters for the period August 1, 2022 - the date of this request. Records should also include any and all exemptions from VMI policies, regulations, memorandums or other governance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Child care provider data (Child Care Licensing Bureau, Baton Rouge)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Child care provider data (Child Care Licensing Bureau, Baton Rouge)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:
